newsitem.title: CHINA: China foreign trade minister to visit U.S.
newsitem.headline: China foreign trade minister to visit U.S.

text.p: China's Foreign Trade Minister Wu Yi will visit the United States this month for consultations on bilateral trade issues, the Xinhua news agency said on Sunday.
Wu will head an economic and trade delegation to the United States from Sept. 26-27 at the invitation of U.S. Commerce Secretary Mickey Kantor, Xinhua said.

Wu and Kantor would co-chair the 10th meeting of the Sino-U.S. Joint Committee of Commerce and Trade, discussing trade and investment, legal issues and industrial cooperation, the agency said. It gave no further details.
U.S. trade officials this month announced punitive charges against China's 1996 textile and apparel quotas.

Beijing urged the United States not to politicize trade disputes by slashing the quotas, saying the door was open for consultations to reach a conclusion satisfactory to both sides. China has pledged to crackdown on illegal transshipments of textiles.
In February 1995 and in June this year, Beijing and Washington only narrowly avoided what would have been a bruising trade war over China allowing widespread copyright piracy to go unchecked.
